alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:57PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Albany County through 645 PM MDT... At 556 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, or near Laramie, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium and Yellow Pine Campground around 600 PM MDT. Laramie around 605 PM MDT. Baldy Peak around 630 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 305 and 324. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for southeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
